She also thinks she will present my file on Monday to the Board (?) I am hoping for low score as well. Again, thanks, your answers have helped me emotionally!
Posts.Title: Oncotype Test Dkissel san4850

Posts.Content: Dkissel wrote: I just had my first visit with the Oncologist and she is sending my slides off for Oncotype testing. I am interested in hearing from you ladies that have had this done and how you made your decisions. She is all ready talking Chemo and I just don't know if that is the way to go. My tumor was 8 mm, stage one with three nodes removed and one had a 1/2 mm spot in it. ER + PR - Any advise? Dx 3/15/2007, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 1/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Oncotype Test Dkissel san4850

Posts.Content: May 22, 2007 11:55AM Dkissel wrote: Well, the results are in. I have a score of 22 and we are in agreement that we are only doing radiation and then hormone therapy. The numbers just did not scream that I need chemo, I am at peace with the decision and feel a big weight lifted. Now, the next phase, I see the Radiation dude next Thursday for the consult. THANK YOU for all your advise and help, it certainly was worth it and helped me sleep at night.
Posts.Title: Oncotype Test Dkissel san4850

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2007 06:55AM Dkissel wrote: Hi all, I finished last Friday and wake up each day this week saying, wow...no radiation today! My doctor had me use absolutely NOTHING during treatment on my skin and then the day I finished, aloe only (I got pure, organic aloe) and am to use it three times a day. I must say, I am doing great! I had two little spots that peeled and were tender so, I used the aloe and then I put a piece of 100% cotton between my breast and bra (another suggestion was to use a mini-pad folded or two put together and then lay between the breast and bra. I have been really comfortable and we are on vacation in the hot south and this cotton is absorbing the sweat as well as giving me some protection. I am really happy with these results. Monday, I go back to my oncologist and see what is next. I really want to look at options rather than just taking the tamoxifen or other medication...but as my husband says---we are in the home stretch now. THANK YOU all for allthe info and support!
Posts.Title: June 07 Rads leebrigs Lynn12
